dmca.title: [EV1-C2017614A] marketingparadise.com -- violating copyright, and running a spam blog
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the
Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your
claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/index.html?p=copyright.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: abuse@ev1.net [mailto:abuse@ev1.net] 
Sent: Saturday, December 02, 2006 11:11 PM
To: DMCA
Subject: [EV1-C2017614A] marketingparadise.com -- violating copyright,
and running a spam blog.

From: abuse@theplanet.com
Subject: [EV1-C2017614A] marketingparadise.com -- violating copyright,
and running a spam blog.
Reference: [EV1-C2017614A]

For your review. 

--
Regards,
Abuse Department
The Planet - EV1Servers
http://theplanet.com/legal/index.html
http://ev1servers.net/About/aup.aspx
http://ev1servers.net/About/tos.aspx

TAG_LEVEL=4.0 QUARANTINE_LEVEL=1000.0 KILL_LEVEL=8.0 WHITELISTED
Return-Path: toxic@doobie.com
X-OriginalArrivalTime: 03 Dec 2006 10:59:08.0484 (UTC)
FILETIME=[0E710040:01C716CA] 

MIME element (text/plain) 
the site marketingparadise.com, running on the server with the IP  
address of 66.98.180.49, is running a spam blog. 
 
They appear to be collecting content from blogs and other sources on the

internet, and publishing it as their own.  
 
 
The following pages reprint snippets from an article that I wrote (and  
that I hold the copyright to).  They mention me by name (and slice up my

content to the point where it's almost nonsensical).  I do not want my  
name associated with this site, and I did not give authorization for  
this content to be used in this manner. 
 
http://marketingparadise.com/info/direct-tv-satellite-internet/3186/ 
http://marketingparadise.com/info/direct-tv-satellite-internet/ 
 
 
I assume that the entire domain is a violation of your terms of service

(it's clearly being set up as an ad-farm, splog, or other worthless  
site, and is currently churning along with other people's content in an

effort to raise page rank).  Please shut it down. 
 
In the event that the site itself isn't a violation of your terms,  
please let me know.  To get my name and writing off of the site, I'd  
most likely follow up with a DMCA takedown notification (and considering

how many people's content is here, I doubt I'd be the only one) 
 
Thanks 
-Jeff
